Monday, May 6, 2019

5:30 PM

May 6, 2019

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of $200,000 from Free Cash to the Public Investment Fund Traffic and Parking Department
Extraordinary Expenditures for Traffic Signals, based on mitigation funding that the City has received
from the Encore Casino project. These funds will be used to cover the cost of acquiring traffic
monitoring units to be installed at multiple intersections that we expect will be impacted by the
opening of the new casino.
CMA 2019 #127
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

2. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 18-74, regarding the Anthony Paolillo Tot Lot water feature and installing new trash
and recycling Big Belly bins together with a new sunscreen dispenser in the park within the next
month.
CMA 2019 #128
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 19-52, regarding solutions to the Rindge Avenue area waste disposal and rodent
concerns.
CMA 2019 #129
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 18-143, regarding requiring a Business Entity’s Beneficial Ownership and Residential
Real Estate Beneficial Ownership Transactions be Disclosed in all Cambridge Real Estate
Transactions.
CMA 2019 #130
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

5. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to a response to
questions contained in Policy Order Number 5 of April 29, 2019 regarding the proposed Cannabis
Business Permitting Ordinance.
CMA 2019 #131
RESULT:
REFERRED TO ORDINANCE COMMITTEE FOR HEARING SCHEDULED
FOR MAY 9, 2019

PAGE 2

May 6, 2019

II. CALENDAR

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to proposed
amendments to the following ordinance: and proposed amendments to Chapter 14.04 of the
Cambridge Municipal Code (the "Fair Housing Ordinance). Fair Housing (passed to a 2nd
reading) AWAITING HOME RULE LEGISLATION-BEFORE PROPOSAL CAN BE
ORDAINED
CMA 2018 #234
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

2. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 18-108, regarding a report on offering early voting in City Council and
School Committee Elections. PENDING RESPONSE FROM LEGISLATURE
CMA 2018 #286
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

3. An application was received from Citizens Bank, requesting permission for a 1 illuminated
projecting sign and 7 awnings at the premises numbered 822 Somerville Avenue, approval has
been received from Inspectional Services, Department of Public Works, Community
Development Department and no abutter response.
APP 2019 #3
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the proposed
Cannabis Business Permitting Ordinance. ON OR AFTER APRIL 22, 2019 THE QUESTION
COMES ON PASSAGE TO BE ORDAINED
CMA 2019 #86
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

5. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $3,000,000 to provide funds for the Municipal
Facilities Improvement Plan. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON
ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #103
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 3

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

May 6, 2019

6. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $800,000 to provide funds for various Schools for
repairs to entrance doors, upgrade of energy management software, replacement of analog phone
system with the voice over internet protocol (VOIP), and the replacement of an emergency
generator. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #97
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

7. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $20,500,000 to provide funds for various water
pollution abatement projects, including construction of sewer separation, storm water
management and combined sewer overflow reduction elimination improvements within the
Alewife area. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #100
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

8. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $4,000,000 to provide funds for the reconstruction of
various City streets and sidewalks. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES
ON ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #99
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

9. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $10,000,000 to provide funds for the construction of
improvements at City Hall. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON
ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #102
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

10. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $22,000,000 to provide funds for the construction of
improvements at the Fire Station Headquarters Building located at 491 Broadway. ON OR
AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #98
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 4

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

May 6, 2019

11. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $4,000,000 to provide design and construction of Eliot
Street between JFK St. and Brattle St. which is a continuation of the Harvard Square Kiosk and
Plaza and Surface Enhancement project. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION
COMES ON ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #101
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

12. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $10,000,000 to provide funds for the design and
reconstruction of the Tobin School building. If approved, this appropriation will be included in
the City’s FY20 bond issue. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON
ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #104
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/13/2019 5:30 PM

13. A communication was received from Donna P. Lopez, City Clerk, transmitting a report from
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone and Councillor Craig A. Kelley, Co-Chairs of the Ordinance
Committee, for a public hearing held on April 2, 2019 to continue discussion on a petition filed
by the City Council to amend the Zoning Ordinance of the City of Cambridge in section 4.22 to
allow for a special permit for the alteration of a single, two-family or accessory structure in
existence as of January 2019 to provide one accessory apartment, if appropriate conditions are
met. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON ORDINATION
CRT 2019 #27
RESULT:
PASSED TO BE ORDAINED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey, Councillor
Zondervan

ABSENT:

Mayor McGovern


PAGE 5

May 6, 2019

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. An application was received from Cambridge Arts Council requesting permission for a temporary
banner across the public way located at 795 Massachusetts Avenue in front of City Hall, and JFK at
Mount Auburn Streets announcing the Cambridge Arts River Festival through May 13, 2019-May 27,
2019.
APP 2019 #29
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF 8 MEMBERS

2. An application was received from MIT Visual Arts Center requesting permission for fifteen
temporary banners on Ames Street, Memorial Drive to Main Street, announcing the Center's
upcoming exhibition on Ericka Beckman May 21, 2019-July 26, 2019.
APP 2019 #30
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF 8 MEMBERS

3. An application was received from Central Square Business Association, Michael Monestime
requesting permission for four (4) temporary banners along Massachusetts Avenue on poles M54,
M49, M52 and M47 announcing Wild Rabbit Community Moto Show on May 7, 2019-May 12,
2019.
APP 2019 #31
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF 8 MEMBERS

4. An application was received from Cambridge Arts Council requesting permission for eleven (11)
temporary banner poles along Massachusetts Avenue pole numbers M105, M108, M102, 97, M94,
M91, M83, M60, M53 1/2, M58 and M53 announcing Cambridge River Festival May 15, 2019-June
3, 2019.
APP 2019 #32
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF 8 MEMBERS

5. A petition was received from residents at Thomas Graves Landing opposing PUD 8 by New England
Development requesting Special Permit to exceed the 85' height limit at CambridgeSide.
APP 2019 #33
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE PETITION

6. A Zoning Petition Has been received from the Self Storage Group, regarding a revised Zoning
Petition seeking to create the New Street Overlay District. Based on the feedback received
concerning their earlier petition.
APP 2019 #34
RESULT:
REFERRED TO ORDINANCE COMMITTEE AND PLANNING BOARD FOR
HEARING AND REPORT

PAGE 6

May 6, 2019

May 6, 2019

V. RESOLUTIONS
1. Retirement of Kevin Pierce from the Cambridge Housing Authority.
Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2019 #144
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

2. Congratulations to the Cambridge Community Center (CCC) on its 90th Anniversary Gala on
Thursday, May 9, 2019.
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2019 #145
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

3. Retirement of Chenier Durand from the Inspectional Services Department.
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2019 #146
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

4. Congratulations to "Tex Mex Eats" owner Amanda Escamilla on her extended pop-up restaurant on
1193 Cambridge Street.
Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2019 #147
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

PAGE 10

May 6, 2019

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. City Council support of bills opposing Weymouth Compressor Station/Fracked Gas.
POR 2019 #157
Vice Mayor Devereux, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

2. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to confer with the appropriate departments to check
on the condition of the American flags throughout public institutions in the City and replace any flag
in disarray before Memorial Day.
POR 2019 #158
Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

3. City Council support of H.1948 S.1332 Out of Hospital Birth Access and Safety Act.
POR 2019 #159
Mayor McGovern, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Mallon, Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

4. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Cambridge Police Department and other
relevant City staff on how media collected by hand-held photo/video recording devices is used,
stored, and shared.
POR 2019 #160
Councillor Kelley, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

5. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the appropriate City staff on how a cloud-based
data management system for DHSP's Children and Youth Programs will clearly protect all aspects of
participant privacy and access security.
POR 2019 #161
Councillor Kelley
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

6. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to direct the appropriate City staff to determine a
suitable location to dedicate in Cheryl-Ann Pizza-Zeoli’s honor.
POR 2019 #162
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

PAGE 11

May 6, 2019

7. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Traffic, Parking and Transportation Department
and the License Commission to establish a "play streets" permit.
POR 2019 #163
Councillor Mallon, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT
MEMBERS

8. Welcoming Community Ordinance
POR 2019 #164
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Mallon, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF SEVEN
MEMBERS
COUNCILLOR TOOMEY RECORDED AS PRESENT

9. That the City Council request DCR’s presence at a future hearing of the Transportation & Public
Utilities Committee to discuss design options on Memorial Drive Greenway Improvements Phase 3.
POR 2019 #165
Councillor Zondervan, Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS

10. Moving that the Affordable Housing Overlay Discussion Be Favorably Forwarded to Ordinance
Committee
POR 2019 #166
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT
MEMBERS

PAGE 12

May 6, 2019
